intro: Satureja intricata var. intricata, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its fragrance is reminiscent of thyme and oregano, making it a popular choice for culinary and medicinal uses. It is also valued in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and antiseptic properties.
